review: I gave Chilis in Clark another shot. There seems to be some new management and new staff. The food was good. Ribs steak and salads all came out as ordered and fairly quickly. The condition of the restaurant has improved with tables and floors clean and maintained. A much better dining experience.

First time at this location an their was just a 15 min wait but no biggie ...ordered some appetizers which cane out fast and the new Kiosk machine is great for games an u can pay ur bill on it an browse the menue as well ..waiter was very polite
Not bad, I mean it's chili's... prices ok staff very friendly (they brought us different types of beer to try...) food ok

I came here to celebrate my friend's birthday. We went for Happy Hour. The location was right next to Barnes N Noble. It wasn't crowded when we got there so it was pretty quiet. We ordered some margaritas which were okay. They could have been stronger for the price they were charging. For appetizers, we ordered wings and sadly i found hair in my food. I had them take it back. The manager came by later to apologize. The rest of the food was good. It was okay, nothing special to rave about. As the evening progressed, it did start to get louder and more crowded. The waiter was okay, a bit hard to find at times but he was helpful, not as attentive as I would have liked. This place is a typical chain restaurant, so its a hit or miss when coming. Everything was overall just about average.

The waiter was either extremely new or socially awkward. He was short and barely let us get a word out and we had to say the order two or three times before he got it. He spoke to us while leaning over another table ! And when we asked for a refill on a drink he told us it would be a whole because he had to drop something off at the kitchen and then make the drink .  Once the chips came they were cold . And when my friend received her steak it was barely cooked. She asked for medium and it was PURPLE ! And my chicken was ice cold! We sent her food back, they brought her back the same steak and it was still purple ! When we complained our waiter asked if we just wanted to eat it anyway.. ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE SERVICE ! I will not be going back

Went there for dinner to take advantage of a triple reward points offer.  Management was clueless that it was going on.  Server didn't know if I would be credited triple reward point to my account either.  Despite the place being deserted, we were seated in a booth which had a 12" tear in the seat cushion.  Common sense would be to seat customers in that booth last.  Guess common sense is less common than I thought.  Food was okay.

I have never been a fan of Chilis but I've been coming here quite often.. I usually come here to get their chocolate chip cookie skillet which is amazing. And they also have amazing chicken fingers. I really can't say anything about their food because the few times I came here I got chicken fingers. The wings are really good. Their steak taste like a normal steak nothing fancy. And the cookie skillet.. The service is ok. But the only thing I don't like is I went there once around 11 and I ordered fries and they were gross. They were closing in a few so they must of gave me the last of their fries before they change the oil the next day so I wouldn't come here late at night. I would come earlier so the food taste better.

This place for me is 50/50. Sometimes I go and its great service and sometimes i go and i get the worlds worst sever. The food is consistent with most franchise restaurants. If you need a quick bite to eat its a OK choice

I like this Chain. This was my first time at this particular location,  and it was ok.  The interior is definitely nicer than other locations I've been to. This one had more of a Sports Bar look.  I had a specialty magarita that was way too sweet,  but a good amount of alcohol.  I believe it was the pineapple,  and a berry magarita. I hope this isn't the taste of all of them...if so; someone could go into shock. Other than that my service was good, and my appetizer came out promptly.

My husband and went here yesterday the girl took our order I told her we would start with spinach and artichoke dip and for lunch we would have flatbread for me husband ordered burger after a while the server brought out everything when I took her we ordered dip as appetizer she said no one told me and she is the one who took our order  I talked to manager told him what happened he did not even give us a free drink or dessert   I have been coming here from day one but will not return after this I feel they just do not care about customers Too bad

I've been coming to chilis for as long as I can remember. This place was always a go-to for my family and I would never complain. The service here is always great, I have never had a bad server. The food is always delicious and if anything is not the way you like it they will gladly fix it. Food is delicious and filling. The two for twenty offer is great and has good options.
Not bad. Food is consistent and tasty. Young staff aims to please. Nice hangout for the 30's crew.

The worst Chili's in the world.   Badly managed and bad attitudes from the staff.  First and last visit to this location.   I never had a bad experience at a Chili's before.   Made me wait 30 minutes when there were many tables available.   Asked for a table that was open for over 10 minutes and was told i wouldn't get a table until  everyone else in front of me was seated regardless of size of party.  Bathroom extremely dirty.  Appetizers and meal bought at the same time.  Steak over cooked and dry.  What a waste of time and money.  Bottom line this place sucks just stay away.
Waiting on long lines and when the food comes out its always very salty and over cooked!!  Staff is unprofessional.

I used to always enjoy my time at Chili's, but this most recent visit, they were out of a lot of things; more specifically their drinks. I had to order a drink 3 times before they could come back with a beer on tap that was in stock. The waiter was genuinely sorry for the inconvenience. You could tell they were a little short staffed at the time because they couldn't give us the appropriate attention my table needed. I'd be willing to go back again though because this was my first "meh" experience with them.

Extremely dirty.  I could not believe the amount of garbage on the floor, straw wrappers, food, crayons, all over the entire restaurant's floor.  They have two hosts on the weekends, and I never understood why they did not have the responsibility to wipe down the menus.  Very unappetizing when you open a menu and there is old food, and stains all over it.
I would say above average for a chain restaurant,  food was better then expected and servers were very polite and attentive. Definitely make this a couple times a months stop.

Came here just for drinks & sat at the bar.   Staff was very attentive at this location.  I've been to a few where the staff really couldn't be bothered with bar patrons (not good if your a bartender)

Worst Chili's ever..been here the last five times and all five times there is a wait when half the restaurant is empty..extremely poor management..chili's chain are ok but the one in Clark is horrible.

I had a very unpleasant experience here. The service was great- I had a very nice waitress- but the food was just sad. I have been here a few times before and all my experiences have been positive, but this time was extremely underwhelming. We ordered the wings, egg rolls and fried pickles and all were good except the pickles, which were way too salted- it was mostly batter and very small pieces of pickle. For our main courses we got chicken tostadas, sliders, and a fajita. They didn't even ask how I'd like the sliders cooked, so they were overcooked for my taste. The tostadas were nasty (just a pile of mush) and did not taste like anything. The fajitas included only SIX small slices of beef and they were very skimpy on everything- even the cheese. I will not be returning to this Chili's ever again.

Yes it's a Chili's, yes it's not fine cuisine, yes I know it's a chain and I'm giving it five stars. For all that Chili's is, this spot is consistent and has some great service. There are so many great waiters at this location and the service is consistently good.  The food is pretty good, especially their Mexican dishes, try their chicken and shrimp fajitas! They swap out the menu seasonally but keep classic items on all the time. They switch out some appetizers, entrees, and desserts every so often and the food is good. It's sort of like comfort food here and it's a comfortable spot to go sit and relax in while chowing down on some delicious food. The drinks here are pretty great as well. Who can beat $5 presidente margaritas? They are strong and tasty!  Happy hour specials and always rolling out coupons and deals online as well. Plenti card members get emails and discounts sent to use here.  I hadn't had one of their molten lava cakes until a few years ago and I'm pretty hooked now. I've tried all of the different variants but the original is the way to go. Such a delicious dessert. I've even come here just to get that!  This location is often busy but they keep everything clean and as I mentioned before, the staff are great. Friendly and efficient service.

It's been about 3 years since I've been to this location . I noticed the menu changes and physical changes of the restaurant . I ordered the coconut rum punch and the chili chicken entree . The drink barely tasted like there was alcohol in it , but I finished the whole thing because It helped curb the the spice in my entree . The chili chicken entree was hot and seasoned very well . My boyfriend ordered the steak fajitas , which were also on point with the seasonings and I enjoyed the black beans he had on the side . Additionally , I appreciate they are very generous with the chips and guacamole appetizer , we could barely finish it . Our server came around many times to check on us without being annoying which is another plus . Overall 7.5/10 experience .

It's hit or miss sometimes I have good experiences and then I have bad ones. My waitress was good but we did have to ask for our milk 3 times. We only came for the cheese queso app and deserts. Our deserts r the same we order all the time but they didn't put extra finesses as they always done in past must have been the chef. Overall food was decent and deserts still warm. I like going there for use of my Plenti points. Again it's a hit or miss franchise spot some days you get other days eeehhh
Our server Paul was fantastic! Ordered 2 for $22. At 440 calories for a meal, it was delicious!

They really gotta do better with take out .. this place is literally right around the corner from my gym so I come here from time to time when I want a decent meal. Weather it's 10 ppl in the resturant or 50.. it seems like you always have to wait on your food even tho you call it in! In addition to that ..when you do get there.. it's very rare the person at the register will even greet you..let alone acknowledge the fact that your even there (this has happened several times and the place was almost empty!!)  I called my order in around 7.. they said it would only be 30 minutes..I gave them  45 mins because I had to run other errands.. I get there and the person took my payment ..came out with other food (none of which was mines ) .. didn't say anything to me and proceeded to give the person that came in "after" me ..there food !? I'm like "hello"-is my food coming out any time soon !!!? The person then went to the back and took another 5-10 mins to bring the food out that was already called in !?  It seems like you have to wait every time for a take out order. I don't think I will be back here anytime soon.
It's been a staple in Clark for years.  Easy-going atmosphere with a friendly vibe.  Only thing they needed to do is cut that disco music
Can't beat the 2 for $22 deal. Great drinks and great service at the bar. What else can you ask for?

Have not been here in long time. But liking this place a lot after my visit today. Only complaint today would be it's far to cold in the building. Great air conditioning going on here.  I went with the Caribbean Salad. Love the fresh fruit they put in it. The portion was just right. I used to come here for the crispy fingers years ago. Now I'll return for the salad.  The service was very good. Attentive definitely.  Great choice tip come here to get a break from the parkway traffic.
Definitely pays to participate in the Chili's/Plenti rewards program. Great app, great rewards, great solution to feeding our Monday night football family!

I never usually give five stars especially to a chain restaurant. But this location and this particular restaurant definitely served its purpose We came here for happy hour and we are from NY and the prices were just right we have never been to chilis and we were just amazed at the options and the appetizer options. We had maybe 6 drinks and ordered 4 to go appetizers and our bill was less than 60 which was beyond us.  The service was great. We were seated right away. I forgot our sever name but he was so chill he gave us enough space, didn't linger but was always right there if we needed a drink or anything else to order.  We also had dessert it was some kind of brownie with ice cream and fudge and I'm not sure if it was all the drinks or it was the fact that it was actually really good but it tasted amazing. I definitely would go back and I would go to the same location so I'm willing to take the 2 hour drive !

Went to Chilies on Central Ave,Clark our server was Paul who was very attentive, quick with our drink and food order the restaurant was clean for dinner rush  service and our food and drinks came out as requested. We ordered the shrimp and Steak fajitas , which came out  piping hot and delicious. No complaints only praise if in the area we will dine hear again

I usually liked this Chili's, but not so much lately.  Our waiter was very nice and as attentive as he could be since it seemed that he was alone in our section.  The salads used to be fantastic, but the lettuce they're using is limp and not appealing these days at all Chili's!  The chain seems to be going down hill unfortunately since I really enjoyed it in the past!

Food was average. I got the punch drink and although it tasted great it took a while to get and barely had any alcohol (it wasn't cheap either). Went on a Friday night and was surprised that they close so early. Our server was very friendly and she made our time there very pleasant.
Went here on a Saturday night, really crowded however they take your number and text you when your table is available which is convenient. Food was very good

I often pick up take out from Chillis and it's usually hot, tasty and fresh.  Today I got the flatbread salad and the avocados were nasty!  The salad was good and fresh as well as the flatbread ! I would order it again because I like it but I would hope they would stop placing rotting avocados on take out just because you don't see it until you get home!

Similar to other comments here, this place is a bit above average for a chain restaurant. But they do play good music, old time Bruce (this is jersey afterall, hello!), Billy Joel and the like. That makes you feel comfy and al.ost at home. Service is fine. These little table top gadgets mean they cut back on the wait staff, so one poor guy is running food and drinks out to everyone. Not his fault he gets a Lil behind

I can see why this place has a low rating. Our server was not good. We were there for a late lunch (3:00 pm), so it wasn't very crowded. We had to ask for everything: straws (after we got our drinks), plates for our appetizer (after we got it), and refills (second request). I'm so glad that we could pay the bill at our table's little tablet so that we didn't have to deal with our server again. The food was ok though (3 stars), but we probably won't visit this place for a while if at all. And, Mr. Waiter, I am not your "buddy" so please don't call me that.
Great place to take the family. The food is average. But this place is clean. Good service. Tvs all over the place. So great place to watch football

5 minutes was not too long to be seated... The host and my server were very friendly. Food was not as ordered... The steak was great but the ribs were tough as shoe leather, (hmmm now that I think about it they had to be tougher) side of brocolli was cold "I want my babyback babyback babybacks?" Shut the front door... I want my money back!

I've had several horrible experiences at this chilis location. Staff is extremely rude, food takes a long time to be made. The last time I came to this restaurant the lady did not want to accommodate my family of 6, she wanted us to sit at a table for 4 where we did not fit comfortably. I asked to speak to the manager and she did not help us either.
Can't believe they charge for the games on kiosk and they charge 2.59 for selzer. Food good
All good until I noticed mold on the pineapple in my drink ...... Not cool . But glad the server handled it quickly .
Good food, great service, my waiter was very attentive.  I'd say it's above average for a chain restaurant.

How is is conceivable that a chain named after a great American classic has the audacity to serve a pre-mixed bowl of gelatinous goop, and pass it off as something resembling actual chili? I tried adding various unpleasant hot sauces, but i couldn't make it past the first spoonful. The young kids hired as waiters try their best,  but there is nothing that could save a lunch as distasteful as that.  To top it off, the manager who came over to serve the plain, rare burger I ordered to replace that pseudo-chili abomination, just stood there, zombie-like, staring at companion and I, not even saying, "I'm sorry", or  "Can i offer you a drink". If you have any interest in authentic, fresh, bold Chili-avoid this namesake joint like the plague!

*2.5 Stars*  This is not any different than any other Chili's I have been to. Always busy even during the weekdays at an "off peak" time.  I did like the following:  -Comfy chairs at the bar.  -2 for $20 deal (split app and one entree each) I didn't like:  -Alcohol is way overpriced for a chain (no specials)  -Bar service is sporadic We opted for the chips and quac app (mind you the portions are smaller). It was good and the quac is a bit spicy which I love.  For a meal I went with the Bacon Ranch Quesadilla's and my gf decided on the chicken fajita's. Portions were normal sized and they both seemed to hit the spot. Like most chain restaurant meals, food is always saltier.  You cannot beat the price for the meal deal but when you add alcohol it doesn't seem that much of a "deal".
Ordered Salmon with grilled chicken with 2 bottles of Heineken. Their choice of draft beers is no good. Actually, I had to settle for Heineken since the didn't have Carona Xtra, it's ok :)

I can't believe so many people actually eat this garbage. Everything is frozen and put into a fryer or microwave. If it was not for the sauces they give you to mask the flavors the food would belong in the trash. It's over-priced to boot. The last 3 times I've been to this Chili's it has become worse and worse. It took 2 1/2 hours one day just to eat lunch with slow service even though the place was 30% full. The next time we said we would not go back because of sub-par quality. Finally went again after a few years and the tacos my wife had were cold with stale shells/ tortillas. The burger bites I had tasted like they were under a heat light for hours, dry and the meat was well done although I requested medium. I also was given a small amount of fries that literally cost would cost them .25 more to give me a fair amount. The only thing edible that night were the chips and salsa. Waste of money even though the manager took some things off. This being a top producing location in the country just proves people don't know what good food is.

I should have read the yelp reviews before having dinner here yesterday. They're so true. My entrée was a Beef Chipotle bowl. A small portion of beef and the other parts were not fresh...A disappointment. To top off my dining experience, my wife and I were swatting fruit flies...We wont be back.

Not sure what happened to this place, but it's awful.  The service is horrendous, and the food even worse.   There must have been a change in management because the quality of food and service has gone down hill in the past year.  It's always crowded, so one would think that's a good sign. It's not. I think people come for cheap drinks at the bar.  They've updated the decor, and it looks nice.  However, they need to do something about the quality of the food, and train their servers better. They're slow, inattentive, and often get the food orders wrong.  Also, the food for the "To Go" is ALWAYS, ALWAYS, ALWAYS luke warm at best. Yuk is the best way to describe the food here! If you absolutely have to eat here, I suggest that you have a few margaritas before eating your food.  Maybe then you won't notice the awful taste!

Ok for drinks and apps. Top shelf jalapeño bbq chicken enchiladas disappointing.  Bland. Rice and beans side-yum. Kids little chicken crispers with side of pineapple below average.  Pineapple slices not trimmed of full rind or core. Waiter very nice. The new table game was $0.99 now - it's been free the last three times we were here. Drug pusher tactics!  I will do my best to avoid returning. Temp set at 68 so bring a sweater.
I love the Presidente Margarita, but that's really about it.  Great for happy hour with coworkers.  Had the grilled chicken salad with the honey lime vinaigrette.

I ordered chicken fajitas. The condiment spinner that they give you was filled with old hard shredded cheese . I was disgusted and surprised! This place used to be a great place to eat!  Wth happened?

It is alright here. the first time bf and I went, we had a really odd waiter who I guess didn't believe I was 21 and hesitated on giving me my vodka tonic even though I had already shown him ID. Then the rest of the night he was very awkward and I felt like he was behind me the whole time. Almost like he was trying to listen to our conversation. We just laughed about it but it was definitely weird.  I also went not too long ago and it felt like the waiter was trying to kick us out the entire time. Very rushed. A friend and I ordered an appetizer and before we could even begin to eat, my plate came out but hers was no where to be found. So by the time hers came, mine was cold sitting on the side of the table.  Needless to say, I've experienced better hence the 2 stars.
Food as good as any Chilis. But the service is painfully slow. At least there wasn't the usual half hour wait. Which I won't wait for. Not for a Chilis anyway. Still waiting...
Wine served in DIRTY glassware (twice).  Laminated menus and on-table ordering devices visibly greasy, covered with sticky splatters, and gross.  Bathrooms filthy.

Atmosphere is the usual Chili's experience. The waitress was very nice, yet very slow in getting our drinks delivered. They arrived after the appetizers. This was probably due in part because we were seated right by the kitchen and whatever antics were going on in the kitchen, it was very loud and unprofessional. Furthermore, There was a gathering of female servers crowded around one male server by our table and the kitchen, spewing everything unprofessional and acting like a know-it-all. It disrupted the quiet dinner I was having. The food I ordered was not prepared properly. I asked for the dressing to be on the side for my salad and and was served with dressing on the salad. I would have stayed and ordered another drink or two, but the loud sounds coming from the kitchen and having to listen to a know-it-all server spew BS rather than worry about his tables made my experience bad. Probably won't visit this location again.

It's a Chilli's, nothing special.  Would rather drive an extra 5 minutes to downtown Westfield or Rahway for a better dining experience at a mom and pop. The place does get very crowded on the weekends and for happy hour.  Actually, I am always shocked at how crowded the restaurant is at all times. Also, most of the food is deceivingly unhealthy for you.  Check out nutritional content before dining, some options that don't seem like they will hurt that much can really set you way back.

This place has consistently bad service. It has actually become a joke with me and my wife. We go to chilis if we want to eat cheap. Because the manager always comps one of the meals when things get screwed up. The food itself isn't bad (it's a chain, however good that gets), but the staff is obviously not in it to win it. Honestly, go to Thailand Restaurant next door. Fresh food, family-owned, healthier and much tastier.
Fast food with wait-service. Bright, loud, run by teenagers, over-run with children and "bar-patrons" - forgettable menu, no big surprises, typical chain MSG fest.
I came here on a Monday night and I thought the service was very good. Food was also good, especially the California chicken flatbread.
Cheesesteak sandwich combo with fries: generous serving of fries, but a very small sandwich.

Received poor service today... $1.00 supermarket hamburger buns for their Turkey guacamole burger that when served was soggy returned for a fajita meal that was an extra $3.00 then compensated with a seemingly generous $6.00 reduction but in actuality I was charged the price of the soggy burger..then the tip chart was way off...increased by 5% more...Oh & was served wine in a glass whisky tumbler :( Hmmm..#Verydissappointed!

we all know when you go to chili's, the food is salty. we went friday night with kids.   everythings was bad.  took forever to get our drinks from bar. the food really is fast food.  a house salad was warm.   lettuce warm,tomato warm. wilted.    one of the fajitas dinners came out wrong.  it took 15 minutes later for my son to get his.   all of us were done with our dinners and he finally got his.   it used to be alot better.   just not worth it.

Service was horribly slow, not to mention after my appetizer it took 35 minutes for my meal to arrive. Meal was good and I did have 5 dollars removed off my bill but definitely will not be coming back.

You know what you're getting when you go to Chili's. You have to be in the mood for the salty, bad-for-you menu, with oversized portions. Even most of the salads clock in at over 1,200 calories! I'm a fan of the black bean burger, chicken enchilada soup, nachos, the new Shiner Bock BBQ burger and the guiltless grilled chicken sandwich. A lot of people like the fries, but I think they're way too salty and usually opt for a different side like steamed brocolli. The "To-Go" service at this location is usually pretty good, but last time I picked up an order they forgot my drink and served me soups that had nothing in the broth (server must have skimmed the top of the soup). Overall, you get a good meal here, like I said though, you have to be in the mood for what they're serving. This location gets very busy at dinner time and parking can be a hassle.
made the mistake of letting my kids talk me into returning, still crap

I like the service here, of course, very familiar faces, friendly. I also enjoy meals and my mango ice tea all the time here. The decor and interior is decent, nothing special. Though, they're not as clean as Applebee's but yeah, it's a good place to eat out with families and friends. Update: I've been here a few more times, surprisingly, they have improve, waiters and waitresses are very knowledgable. Plus some dishes I've tried like Mango-Triple Fliapia is really good! But their rice was bland with not much seasoning. Plus our waiter today was cute. Sorry~ off topic.
Chili customer relation department  quickly responded and offered incentive to return. Thanks Chills Guest Relations. Possibly will try another location

Waited about 10 minutes for a seat at 9 PM in the holiday season.  I ordered the Parmesan-Crusted Steak.  My medium-rare order arrived well done.  The parmesan crusting was meager and sad looking when compared to the heaping mound on the picture.  The toast was plated with the burnt side down (I didn't notice until I had already deemed the meal a fail).  My wife's burger was bland, the "86 the tomato" request was not followed, and her fries were overdone.  We would have sent both meals back, but the server never came back to check on our food.  I would have ordered another beer, but we only saw him when he took the order.  I had to flag down another server to get the check.  Each of our very infrequent visits to Chili's reminds us why we so rarely eat there.
Good service and always consistent. raj is a great manager and always is good to us.

The prices went up for sure! I ordered the fajita trio and it was not fresh or sizzling on the hot plate. My boyfriend ordered the country fried chicken and within hours he was sick to his stomach. I'm sorry for the bad review but Chillie's needs to step up their game.
Ok so first of all the pager we got was broken they said a 10-15 minute wait ended up being 30 mins then they ran out of 2 soups. Food is ok Waiter ehh

This review is based on the bar area during happy hour only.  You cannot beat their happy hour specials. $3 margaritas $2.50 domestic pints and a variety of appetizers between 3-5$. They got me there. The food is typical chain food that won't blow you away but to watch a game here on Sunday it's great. Plenty of televisions and the bartender is very attentive and always friendly. My type of a Sunday Funday.

I love this place.  I have never had a bad meal here and I have eaten here a decent amount.  I have tried almost everything and it was always good.  Every server I have talked to has a great personality.  I know it's just Chili's, but this place is the best.

I live in Clark so my wife and I go to Chilis once or twice a month. The food is always decent and the staff are friendly. There is seldom a long wait and they allow you to call ahead to get on the list when there is a wait, which is nice. Overall, it's decent food at a decent price.
...Chili's good, just like the commercial says...New pretzels appy very good, one of my companies had her usual Texas chesse fries and they were good

After the remodel the food and service has become horrible.  Just went there recently after the last time months ago when I went and waited 15mins and had no server come to our table.  We saw people being seat around us and being served.  We got up and left.  We decided to try it out again since it had been a while.  We ordered skins, they were over cooked dry as a bone even with the cheese on top, and they had a weird oil taste to it.  Out main course came, we ordered the buffalo chicken sandwich, it had the same oil taste, that taste of old oil.  The fries over salted as usual tasted the same.  We won't be going back.

I went to this eatery very hungry & usually food always tastes good when you're hungry right? Not so here! The waiter was a nice teenaged kid, but he couldn't help the disgusting cuisine. They brought out chicken & onions in a sizzling pan and it smelled like disinfectant. GROSS. Food was mediocre. Not much of a selection. I much prefer Chevy's!!! Server kept my soda filled & he was nice, but food was bad. Tasteless. Waste of my money. NEVER will go to a Chili's again

I haven't been at a Chili's in a long time and I've been to this particular location in the past.  This time around I wasn't impressed at all. I was there before choir rehearsal so we didn't have that much time and it was a week night.  We had to wait which it is what it is and I really didn't care much but was surprised.  But it also was after Sandy so people probably still were out of power and just wanting to get out.  So our time at the table chilling would be shorter.  Whatever. Since I'm trying to control swelling in old injuries, I decided to order the combo platter that they have and get the grilled salmon and shrimp with broccoli and rice.  Sounds healthy but no. The salmon had so much salt on it and the same for the rice and my poor broccoli was rotten.   I was horrified to see how degraded the vegetable was and how could they not see that, it was gray.  And they steamed it and put it on the plate and served it.  I had the server bring me more and digging into the bowl, I found more rotten broccoli.  When she came to clean our table I had a pile of rotten broccoli in front of me, do you think when I said again it still wasn't good that they'd knock something off the bill or offer me something else. They did not.   Both my dining partners ordered burgers.  The server did not ask them how they liked their beef and served both like hockey pucks.   Next time I'll pass and go to White Diamond or any other eatery in Clark before I go back.

If you like salt, go here. The server was nice but the food...  I got the table side guacamole. The sever said a little salt as she dumps half the container in the guacamole.  My daughter almost choked on a piece too.  I got the cheese enchiladas and my daughter got the kids pepperoni pizza. The cheese was very salty. I thought it was only mine but then my daughter said this cheese is salty. There you have it. Probably won't come back anytime soon.

I love Chili's!  The food and drinks are awesome and it's inexpensive, especially with the 2 for $20 deal.  The chips and salsa are addictive, and I also really like the fire roasted corn guacamole.  The Quesadilla Explosion Salad is my favorite here.  I also love their french fries and the Molten Lava cake.  Yum.

A very popular place.. Can never see the place slightly empty.. Love the steaks, fajita as for the price they offer it's awesome. At the end it's still a fast food joint but will always do for my steak craves
Order the molten chocolate lava cake and you will love it. Service is great. Try their burgers and salads. I would go back here.
always a good experience- love the wings they are the best. And the cheese cake is totally awesome its out of this world.
Only dish I ever liked here was their ground peppercorn burger, which is now off the menu. Everything else is passable.
food is very salty & some waitresses can be rude and cutting with their comments. the only reason why I would come is for a quick drink or the molten lava cake.
I went here with a couple of friends for my birthday. the margaritas were good. But the baby back ribs were dry.
This place never ceases to amaze!  The portions are copious, the food is delicious & always fresh with selections to appease any taste.

Chili's is definitely one of our favorite places to eat. It's close to home and the service is great at Clark. The food is delicious. There is something for everyone in your family. The prices are very reasonable. Our family has enjoyed many delicious meals. Everyone orders something different so we can share. Whether with your family or a group of friends you are guaranteed to have a good time. Chili's has a very relaxed atmosphere. Make Chili's your next dining experience.

The service at this Chili's is usually better than the one on Oak Tree Road.  The food quality is about the same.  The sweet corn soup is really good, as is the guacamole with corn in it.  I should have passed on the queso, it was so salty!!!  I also ordered a side salad with extra slices of avocado for .75 more.  That only gets you two slices of avocado apparently.

My tennis team goes out to dinner every week, and the first place we always think of going to is Chili's. The atmosphere is awesome and the service is great. We always learn our waitress's name and converse with her. I shouldn't even have to talk about the food, but I will anyway. I always get the giant Southern Smokehouse Bacon Burger, which is incredible, but some of my teammates get the half rack of baby back ribs or even the delicious salads. Everything is exceptional, though. The only problem we had with it was that they don't take reservations for large parties, like us 12, and when we call in ahead of time to ask for the wait, we end up waiting twice as long. Even so, Chili's hands down is the greatest place to go to get good food and hang out with your friends.
